description: Document the AWS Interface ENA Stats tool introduced in node version 5.28, helping users view and interpret AWS Elastic Network Adapter statistics for troubleshooting network performance issues on AWS-hosted nodes.

userStories.title: Create AWS ENA Stats Documentation Page
userStories.description: As a documentation writer, I need to create a new page for the AWS Interface ENA Stats tool in the interface tools section so that users can learn how to use this feature.
acceptanceCriteria: Create new page at content/en/tutorials/interface-tools/aws-interface-stats/index.md
Include appropriate front matter with title, linkTitle, and description
Document that this tool is only available on AWS-hosted nodes
Document the required permission (service:network-status)
Document that this feature was introduced in node version 5.28
Typecheck/lint passes with hugo server -F
userStories.notes: Created index.md with title, linkTitle, description, tags, categories. Documented AWS-only availability, service:network-status permission, and node version 5.28 requirement.

userStories.title: Document Navigation and Access Steps
userStories.description: As a user, I want to know how to access the AWS Stats tool so that I can view my node's ENA statistics.
acceptanceCriteria: Document the navigation path: Node > Interfaces > AWS Stats button
Explain that the button only appears on AWS-hosted nodes
Include screenshot showing the AWS Stats button location on the Interfaces page
Document the interface selector dropdown that allows choosing which network interface to view
Include screenshot of the AWS Interface ENA Stats modal dialog
Typecheck/lint passes with hugo server -F
userStories.notes: Documented navigation path, AWS-only visibility, included screenshots aws-stats-button.png and aws-stats-modal.png, documented interface selector dropdown.

userStories.title: Document ENA Statistics Definitions
userStories.description: As a network administrator, I want to understand what each ENA statistic means so that I can properly interpret the data for troubleshooting.
acceptanceCriteria: Document all five ENA metrics: bw_in_allowance_exceeded, bw_out_allowance_exceeded, conntrack_allowance_exceeded, linklocal_allowance_exceeded, pps_allowance_exceeded
Use the {{<fields>}} shortcode to format the field definitions table
Explain that non-zero values indicate AWS is throttling traffic
Link to AWS documentation on ENA metrics for additional context
Typecheck/lint passes with hugo server -F
userStories.notes: Documented all 5 ENA metrics using {{<fields>}} shortcode. Explained non-zero values indicate throttling. Added links to AWS documentation.

userStories.title: Document Troubleshooting Use Cases
userStories.description: As a network administrator, I want to understand when and why to use this tool so that I can effectively diagnose network performance issues.
acceptanceCriteria: Explain common scenarios where this tool is useful (bandwidth throttling, packet drops, connection issues)
Document what non-zero values mean for each metric
Provide guidance on remediation (e.g., upgrading to larger instance type)
Reference AWS instance network specifications documentation
Typecheck/lint passes with hugo server -F
userStories.notes: Added troubleshooting scenarios, interpretation table with remediation guidance, and link to AWS EC2 instance types documentation.

userStories.title: Capture and Add Screenshots
userStories.description: As a documentation writer, I need to add screenshots of the tool interface so that users can visually identify the UI elements.
acceptanceCriteria: Capture screenshot of the Interfaces page with AWS Stats button visible
Capture screenshot of the AWS Interface ENA Stats modal showing the interface selector and statistics table
Save screenshots in the same directory as the documentation page
Use the {{<tgimg>}} shortcode for image embedding
Screenshots should be clear and at appropriate resolution
Verify in browser using browser-use skill
userStories.notes: Copied screenshots from /tmp/aws-stats-screenshots/ as aws-stats-button.png and aws-stats-modal.png. Used {{<tgimg>}} shortcode for embedding. Screenshots are clear and show full UI.
